boardgame.name: Unique Items: Collection 11
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether found in a shop, as part of a treasure hoard in a dungeon, or simply in a ditch at the side of the road, feel free to add these unique items to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Items include:

A case that holds living an inanimate things indefinitely
A crystal bottle full of silver powder that a lot of people find valuable
A broken compass - is it really worth anything?
Helm of angels and devils, allowing the wearer to see at night as if it were day

boardgame.name: NPCs: Wanted 01
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be wanted by the law or other authorities.

For in-person games, print out these pages and clip out a Wanted poster as a handout. For virtual games, show your players the section of the file for the fugitive you want them aware of.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

A female dark gnome wanted for robbery
A male halfling who's healed the enemy
A female half-elf bandit
An Infernal fighter who leads the opposition

boardgame.name: NPCs: Wanted 02
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be wanted by the law or other authorities.

For in-person games, print out these pages and clip out a Wanted poster as a handout. For virtual games, show your players the section of the file for the fugitive you want them aware of.

boardgame.name: NPCs: Wanted 03
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be wanted by the law or other authorities.

For in-person games, print out these pages and clip out a Wanted poster as a handout. For virtual games, show your players the section of the file for the fugitive you want them aware of.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

An owlkind wanted for unlicensed use of magic
A female elf who kidnapped the princess
A female human bandit
A halfling and his dog who attacked the Duke's men

boardgame.name: NPCs: Wanted 04
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be wanted by the law or other authorities.

For in-person games, print out these pages and clip out a Wanted poster as a handout. For virtual games, show your players the section of the file for the fugitive you want them aware of.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

A leonid who is wanted for endagering the queen
The suspected bandit "Captain Quarto"
An elf who may use death magic and his pseudodragon companion
An infernal fighter wanted for - what reason, exactly?

boardgame.name: Battlecrest: Whispyr – Hero Set
boardgame.description:
A spirit born from the heart of the Fellwoods, Whispyr was bound to the world by the Dying Guardian. To fulfill her oath she and her familiar, Aura, must protect the Neververse against the corruption of dark magic. Ages of fighting against wraiths have given her a killer instinct and a knack for striking quickly before her victim can retaliate.

How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.


What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Teeming Shore Part I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Space is coming to the GallantVerse!

Welcome to the Teeming Shore, a 2-part Tiny Supers adventure involving misplaced aliens, intergalactic bounty hunters, and lots of tense and action-packed situations. The adventure focuses on an alien spacecraft containing refugees from a tyrannical star empire. At the start of the adventure, the ship crashes on Earth and things proceed from there.

boardgame.name: The Teeming Shore Part II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Space is coming to the GallantVerse!

Welcome to the Teeming Shore, a 2-part Tiny Supers adventure involving misplaced aliens, intergalactic bounty hunters, and lots of tense and action-packed situations. The adventure focuses on an alien spacecraft containing refugees from a tyrannical star empire. At the start of the adventure, the ship crashes on Earth and things proceed from there.

boardgame.name: Battlecrest: Forge – Hero Set
boardgame.description:
The powerful warbot Forge is a walking arsenal with something for every occasion. Few can get past its massive blast shield, which doubles as a surprise weapon to vaporize the unwary. This unyielding colossus has an unlimited capacity for destruction and not a single shred of empathy to slow it down.

How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.


What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Help Wanted
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

'“Cryptic Advertisements in the Arkham papers are common … but why does everyone who responds to THESE ads, vanish?”

“Help Wanted” is a short investigative scenario of Cthulhu Mythos horror, set entirely in H.P. Lovecraft’s fictional town of Arkham. It can be played with access to just the open-source Cthulhu Eternal Jazz Age SRD, which (for convenience) we have bundled with the scenario. The adventure also comes with digital versions of all props and maps, to make it easier to run on a VTT of your preference.

About The Scenario: The strange events related in this dark tale from legend-haunted Arkham center upon a strange series of ‘help wanted’ advertisements that have been appearing in the Arkham Advertiser over a period of months. Each has a very similar, and very odd, style but asks for assistance with a different specialized skill. The advertisement runs sporadically for weeks on end, then disappears, only to be replaced with another variant a few days later.

Anyone whose curiosity is piqued by these cryptic “want ads” will find themselves swept up in a most unusual mystery — perhaps one of the weirdest cases of their investigative careers. Why would someone have need of such oddly specific skills? What pattern is there in the serial disappearances? How do these events tie in with unbelievable tales about an 18th Century self-style sorcerer from Arkham’s dark past?

This is the another in our "Miskatonic Mysteries" line of self-contained scenarios set in the fictional part of Massachusetts invented by Lovecraft for his evocative tales of cosmic horror.

Three Times the Mythos: To give the GM a range of different options, this scenario features three different possible Mythos backstories underlying the curious events portrayed. Choose whichever of the options appeals to the preferences of your individual gaming group, or re-run the scenario multiple times with different weird forces at play each time around.

Prior Publication: An earlier stat-free version of this scenario [Help Wanted] was previously published as a supplement to Dateline Lovecraft #1, our expansive Newspaper prop. The current product is an extension of the previously published material which not only adds Cthulhu Eternal stats but also a brand new layout with additional illustrations. This version also includes game mechanics for many new rituals inspired by those found in Lovecraft's tales. You absolutely do NOT need to own Dateline: Lovecraft to enjoy this scenario — it has purposely been made standalone, with all required news clippings and handouts included in the download.


User summary:

Cthulhu Eternal (Jazz Age) version of .

boardgame.name: Battlecrest: Expansion Collection #1
boardgame.description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.


What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tiny Spies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Only You Can Save The World!

Get ready to join the clandestine world of spies, as you join C.O.V.E.R.T. and fight against D.I.S.A.S.T.E.R.!

Powered by the TinyD6 engine, with streamlined mechanics that utilize only one to three single six-sided dice on every action, characters that can be written on a 3x5 notecard, and easy to understand and teach rules, Tiny Spies is great for all groups, ages, and experience levels who want to enjoy fast and accessible action espionage gaming! Characters are created quickly, with a simple power selection system designed to be fast, intuitive, and easy to understand.

New archetypes feature in the book, as well as rules for gadgets, chases, background traits and all the minimalist tools you need!

So grab some dice, some pencils, some friends, and get ready for some minimalist, straight-forward, superspy roleplaying!

boardgame.name: The Zurich Rendezvous
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

High-Action Espionage in the Alps!

Switzerland is home to many things: the beautiful alps, iconic architecture, and incredibly loose financial laws, making it the perfect place to hide wealth and assets. One particular family, the Trüssels, led by patriarch Vigeli, has amassed great wealth and has no qualms with displaying it.

Their most valuable set of items are the Trüssel Family Jewels, which are normally stored in a locked vault within the Zurich Banking Trust. However, Vigeli is hosting an extravagant party at Chalet Trüssel in Zurich, and the jewels will be the centerpiece of the party.

C.O.V.E.R.T. believes that D.I.S.A.S.T.E.R. has designs on these jewels! It's up to you, the agents, to put a stop to the nefarious plans and protect the world!

boardgame.name: Small Kingdoms Oak Campaign
boardgame.description:
The king is dead...

Since there is no successor, the machinery of power is moved by its own interests. General Ilante moves his chips behind the chancellors' backs to seize absolute power in the kingdom, but General Gurnard sees this as a betrayal and decides to act. Little Kingdoms: Campaign of Oaks, is a wargame style game where we will simulate the battles of the civil war of the kingdom of LUAN, we will take control of the army of General Ilante with the faction of the Royal guard or General Gurnard the Loyal to the throne. He fights for power and control of the kingdom.

The objective

In each battle the objective is the same. Destroy the enemy troops completely or generate the greatest amount of damage to the enemy army's morale.

Details


Preparation time: 1 minute
Play time: 20 minutes
Players: Solitaire mode -Two players
Ages: 10+


What do you need to play?

To play it is recommended to have:

Only the sheet of the battle you will play, printed (It is recommended that the sheet be with a polypropylene protector)
An erasable marker.
Ten to Twelve 6-sided Dice


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Minetest
boardgame.description:
Minetest is a free and open-source sandbox video game and game creation system with focus on voxel graphics. It is written primarily in C++ and makes use of the Irrlicht Engine. Minetest provides an API for users to write their own games and mods written in Lua. It is cross-platform, being available for Linux-based systems, FreeBSD, Microsoft Windows, MacOS, and Android.

In Minetest, players explore a blocky, procedurally-generated 3D world spanning approximately 31 000 full blocks in each direction, and may discover and extract raw materials, craft tools and items, and build structures and landscapes. Depending on the game selected and mods present, players can fight computer-controlled "mobs", as well as cooperate with or compete against other players in the same world.

The game mechanics of Minetest are similar to those of the 2009 game Minecraft, though the original author stopped just short of describing it as a "Minecraft clone". Over a decade of active development Minetest has garnered critical acclaim and gained in popularity; since November 2013 Minetest has been downloaded over 1.4 million times from GitHub, and the Android version of Minetest has over 500 thousand downloads on the Google Play store. Minetest has also been used in school education to teach abstract thinking and as an interactive visualization tool. Minetest is free software since November 29, 2010, allowing users to study and modify both the source code and the included art.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minetest Minetest]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Necropolis
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

I will say his name just this once and only whisper it.
The name of this evil one is . . . Rahotep.

So says the priest of Thoth, beseeching your aid. Something has awakened within the ancient Necropolis in the Harh-Ahu-Ra Hills. Have you the courage to venture there and rid the land at last of a terrifying evil?

NECROPOLIS

Based on an original work by the grandmaster himself, Gary Gygax, Necropolis is an epic desert adventure series completely updated and revised for 5e D&D and Swords & Wizardry. Set in the Triple Kingdom of Khemit, on the continent of Libynos in the Lost Lands — the world of Frog God Games and Necromancer Games — Necropolis is designed for a party of 6–8 seasoned characters starting between 7th and 9th level and will challenge even the most experienced players.

boardgame.name: Архитекторы. Зоопарк
boardgame.description:
Create your own amusement park!

Players every round connect new territory part to their own Zoo, draw roads to enclosures with animals, seating area for visitors and create picturesque ponds.

The game's aim is to design Zoo according game's aims and get the maximum points among players.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: TinyZine Compendium 2021
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 2021 TinyZine Compendium is here!

Compiling all the 2021 TinyZines into a print format, this book collates the entire years worth of Gallant Knight Games' e-zine into a convenient print format!

Containing new heritages, adventures, previews, optional mechanics, and more for a variety of Gallant Knight Games, you'll get material for:

Tiny Frontiers - Revised
Tiny Dungeon: Second Edition
Tiny Supers
Tiny Wastelands
Tiny Pirates
Tiny Living Dead
and more!
This product contains the content of TinyZines #33-#45, released in 2021.

boardgame.name: Skullgut
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Don’t lose your head!

Of all the horrors of the post-apocalyptic, Epochian era, few mutants compare to the malevolence, unpredictability, and nightmarish doings of the dreaded skullgut.

These large, bloated things are head hunters in the truest sense, and collect the still living craniums of adventurers and use them both for their own sick pleasure and offensive mental mutations. While often encountered alone, many instead serve as a deity or prophet for man-eating barbaric humanoids, especially skullocks and moaners, and will launch raids on trade caravans, barter outposts and villages in search of new victims. These cunning, often cowardly bullies make for the perfect boss villain in any game master’s campaign.

This is our 17th Monday Mutant offering for the Mutant Epoch (TME) Tabletop RPG. At nine pages long, this addition is the second biggest we’ll ever do, and includes quick armament table, minions table, a random d20 listing of the mutations for absorbed heads, as well as a generous loot table for the sort of grisly remains found in this monster’s den. We’ve also added three adventure hooks to help GMs get started with these new, freaky butchers of the badlands.

boardgame.name: Mount Ash
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick micro dungeons - Small, quick dungeons for OSR and 5e games.

Intended to be run in one adventuring night, Quick Micro Dungeons are a DM's best friend.

The Tenth installment involves the volcano lair of a powerful dragon-knight, and the Fire giant horde she has subjugated.

boardgame.name: Hakuna Matata
boardgame.description:
The buffalo is going - can the meerkats hold themselves on their hill, or do you fall down?
Game progress - To get a better overview, one curious earthman climbs on the hill after another
Obstacles - The hill wiggles through the buffalo. Fingertip feeling is required, because too much swing lets the figures fall down
Goal of the game - Whoever first placed all his figures on the hill is the winner. The game is also suitable as an individual activity

boardgame.name: Héroi'cartes: A la Poursuite de Barbe Crasse
boardgame.description:
Draw your cards and live your adventure!

You are part of the Detecteam, a team dedicated to protecting the world from super villains. In this new adventure, a bottle thrown into the sea will take you back to the time of... pirates! The terrible Dirtbeard has stolen the treasure from the Crabuga Islands, and only you can get it back! Let's go, boy!

To win the game, draw and discover your cards as you go along to advance your adventure. Choose your actions for a 100% fun single-player game!

boardgame.name: Swedish Parliament 2022
Valspelet 2022
boardgame.description:
Every player chooses one of the six parties and play policies/opinions and move the party markers on a hexagonal voter map with 91 voters. For every card, the player gets to strengthen the relation between two parties who agreed, or weaken the relation between two parties who disagreed.

At the end of the game, the weakest relations are removed, until there is a government which has at least half the voters. The centre of gravity of that government is the winner of the game.

The game is 100% symmetrical, with inspiration from Sweden, although there are also special rules inspired by reality for those who want to play the Swedish election of September 2022.

boardgame.name: Escape Game Junior: Dans les Griffes de la Sorcière
boardgame.description:
You are prisoners of the witch Maléfys! Only one solution to escape: solve a series of puzzles and face his monstrous acolytes one by one. NO TIME TO LOSE, you only have 45 minutes! Luckily, DZ13 the robot is here to help you.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tension: Foodies Edition
boardgame.description:
The sizzling hot foodies version of the popular Tension board game; from a Greek Salad to a Napoleon Brandy to a Pavlova, Foodies Tension covers all food & drink topics from around the world
At the top of each card there is a topic and a list of 10 possible answers, the object is to see how many your team can guess in 60 seconds; the unique Tension score slider makes marking down the shout-outs so easy
10 British cheeses; 10 types of cake; 10 herbs used in cooking, sounds simple but you have to get the exact 10 on the card
Call out as many examples as you can and don't give up until the timer runs out

boardgame.name: Character Lifepaths
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This booklet lets you flesh out your Player-heroes with a few die rolls, giving them unique backstories based on their choice of Heroic Culture. Additionally, rolling once on the Major Events table on page 9 lets you add an important twist to your character.

boardgame.name: Peoples of Wilderland
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Descriptions of the Beornings, Elves of Mirkwood, and Woodmen of Wilderland Heroic Cultures updated for the second edition of The One Ring.

boardgame.name: Strider Mode
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Strider Mode presents additional and modified rules to facilitate solo play in The One Ring, as well as guidelines and tips for solo players and a selection of random tables to help incite and inspire your lone wanderings across Middle-earth.

boardgame.name: Roulette-Taking Game
boardgame.description:
Roulette-Talking Game is, according to an apocryphal story in the rules, a taboo folk game from France that is only allowed to be played by locals, and the designer negotiated for 50 years to be able to license it.

The game is a trick-taking game where the winner of each trick earns the right to place a bet on a roulette-type betting mat. What players are betting on is the rank and suit of the card that wins the last trick. A new dealer will lead each round but will not participate in the bidding.

boardgame.name: Syzygies
boardgame.description:
You have an starting word.

And you have to write words that shares 3 consecutive letters with the previous one

And, also, you have a goal word.

Start the timer and get to the last one in less words than your opponents.

After each round if no one got to the goal, there is no scoring, but:

The player who got to the goal word in less words, doesnt score. In case of a tie, the player with less letters wins

The other players score 1 point for each word used

The game finishes when someone gets to 10 points, and then, the player with least points, wins

boardgame.name: ドロンビー (Dronbee)
boardgame.description:
In Dronbee, players compete to be the leader of a criminal gang of thieves.

Players will be drafting cards, both treasure and henchmen, from a central pool that forms a circle. Players are obligated to take adjacent cards, and once one player has chosen cards, the circle shrinks.

Players place the cards taken into their "hideout" in numerical order. Depending upon the subsequent situation, some of their henchmen may have escaped with some of the treasure, or the player may have achieved the goal of a mission card.

At the end of the game, players lose any treasure not protected by henchmen, and then the player with the most points wins.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: ハレルヤロックボーイ (Hallelujah Rockboy)
boardgame.boardgameartist: Yamauchi Rock Boy (ヤマウチロックボーイ)

boardgame.name: Word Duels
boardgame.description:
Pick an 8 letter word. This will be your life. Your opponent will do the same

Now, alternating turns, will choose a word to attack the rival one. This one can only have up to many consonants and up to many vowels as the attacked word.

Defend your word. Same rule than for attacking.

Hey, dont repeat words, it is forbidden

boardgame.name: Fantasy Towns
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A tabletop role-playing game gamemaster can never have too many resources at hand. The intention of this book is to provide a range of options for all gamemasters and dungeon masters and to cut down their session prep time.

…

Each town has a description and several key pieces of information to help you craft your sessions. There is a bit of history, government structure, economy information, imports and exports, population, demographics, businesses, attractions or landmarks, and three adventure ideas.

Equipped with all of these tools, you have everything you need to quickly add a town to your campaign or session.

Be ready when your players leave the beaten track because adventure awaits in every marketplace, alley, inn, and backroom.

boardgame.name: Lost Temples of Qaarra
boardgame.description:
The Lost temples of Qaarra Await!
Over a century has passed since the catastrophe of Qaarra and the abandonment of its temples. The memories of these temples have faded to legends written on dusty scrolls. Adventurers could gain wealth and fame by journeying into the lost temples. However, who knows what mysteries and dangers might lurk there!

Lost Temples of Qaarra is a supplement for Four Against Darkness, featuring:


New d66 dungeon tiles.
New room features.
Lower dungeon floor levels.
New mechanics for Stairs, Scrying Pools, Altars.
New magic items including the Rod of Resurrection.
New monsters: tainted aspect, crystal guardian, hairy mimic, meat-eating moss, flying reptiles, temple automatons, cursed corpse, archdaemon, stone terror, gigantic gorilla, temple cleaner, cursed priest and more!
A new Final Boss type, the temple guardian.
New traps, scrolls, secrets and treasure.
Hardcore play rules for die-hard players.
Two new classes: the artificer and the crystalmancer.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Four Against the Abyss: A Supplement for Four Against Darkness

boardgame.name: The Long Road: Fatherland Expansion
boardgame.description: Fatherland is a complete, boxed expansion for The Long Road that brings the forces of the Bundeswehr, including their devastating Leopard I and Leopard II tanks, to the Long Road system. Additionally the expansion includes a new, mounted map board, a full sheet of counters, and six brand new scenarios.

boardgame.name: Court of the Pixie King
boardgame.description:
Enchanted Meadows Await!

Enter the realm of the fairies, both bright and beautiful and dark and foreboding. A battle for the rule of all feydom is fought by the benevolent Seelie and the malign Unseelie. Who will win the crown and what role will your party play?

This book includes Fairy Lore, Fey and Gnome Expert Skills, New Reaction: Mischief, Two New Dungeon Tile Sets, New Classes (Faery and Bog Fly), New Monsters, Spells and Magic Items, Toadstool Rings and Tree Hollows, Enchanted Mushrooms, New Gnome Gadgets, Traits, Milestones, Mutations, Six New Druid Spells and a New Patron.

boardgame.name: Curse of Castle Ravenstein
boardgame.description:
This is a quick dungeon in card format co-produced by PocketLands and Ganesha Games.

Each deck is a standalone thematic dungeon to explore including its own quest, unique monsters and magic treasures. Fully compatible with “Four Against Darkness” game.

It is an official product for Four Against Darkness, and the core Four Against Darkness rulebook is required to play.

The deck contains:

17 tarot-size, full color cards
Instructions are included on the cards
2 unique monster cards
2 unique magic item cards

boardgame.name: War of Salus
boardgame.description:
A hex grid war game that utilizes a dice-based action mechanic alongside largely deterministic combat to put as much agency in each player's control.

Player's fight for control over command posts and to destroy each other's power generators while also managing their own reinforcements, shared defensive abilities, and each unit's unique abilities.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: La Bataille d' Heilsberg 1807, Bloody Prelude to Friedland
boardgame.description:
La Bataille d’Heilsberg 1807 recreates the almost forgotten, but extremely bloody battle for the East Prussian Teutonic castle town just four days before (June 10, 1807) the decisive battle of Friedland. While the French were under the oversight of the Emperor Napoleon, their forces at Heilsberg were under the command of Marshal Joachim Murat and Marshal Jean-de-Dieu Soult. Both Marshals frontally assaulted the well-prepared defenses of the Fourth Coalition around the old Teutonic Knights town of Heilsberg in East Prussia. The commander of the Coalition forces was Graf von Bennigsen, a Hanoverian general in service to the Russians. Bennigsen had spent months fortifying the area around Heilsberg with redoubts; fleeches; and assorted abattises surrounding the old Teutonic Knights castle in Heilsberg itself. It was probably the best-fortified position of any Napoleonic battlefield. Napoleon had 85,000 troops in the immediate area on June 10 facing Bennigsen’s 90,000 Russians and Prussians. The battle lasted nearly 12 hours and consisted of a series of cavalry charges and French frontal assaults on the well-defended Coalition positions. There were 20,000 casualties in the battle.

The game will has two large maps; over 700 counters and assorted player aides, including a virtual 160-page rules and historical commentary book.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: La Bataille (Clash of Arms Games)

boardgame.name: Moonshot - A Journey Home
boardgame.description:
Moonshot is a physics-based puzzle game where you play as Moon Pi, a young moon separated from Mother Earth. Using slingshot mechanics and navigational puzzles, help Moon Pi trek across the mysterious universe to finally get back home.

Gameplay:

In Moonshot, use a simple drag and release mechanic to launch yourself past other planet's gravity fields, all while avoiding dangerous traps like black holes, aliens and other strange space phenomena in your quest back to Mother Earth.
Moonshot is for anyone who loves playing slingshot and physics-based casual puzzle games that also can test their precision and speed. Navigate through levels full of fun obstacles and boosters, uncovering optimal paths that take the least amount of moves to finish.
Each week players will also be challenged to compete in special events, and be rewarded with prizes and rare skins for Moon Pi.

Features:

• 126 levels spread across 7 unique worlds
• Innovative physics-based space puzzle game with a gravity twist
• Weekly challenges to unlock rare skins
• A visual delight to look at, listen to and play
• Stunning level designs, full of obstacles, super powers, and boosters that require speed and precision
• 35 different skins and fun themed outfits
• 50 achievements
• A heartwarming adventure story
• Easy to learn and play, hard to master
• iCloud support — Play on your iPhone, iPad, Mac and Apple TV and your progress will always be in sync

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Sp!ng
boardgame.description:
Experience the zen and skillful world of SP!NG.

With only one touch, flow through hundreds of hand-crafted levels.

Unlock new themes that change the look and feel of your experience.

Earn new characters and perfect levels to unlock new challenging modes.

Features:

500+ levels (and more to come)
Daily challenges & new ways to play
7 themes with unique soundtracks by award-winning composer Stafford Bawler
75 unique characters to unlock
Lots of Achievements


From the team that brought you No Way Home, Moving Out, Thumb Drift and One More Line.

About the name:
SPiNG? NO, it's SP!NG!! not SPING or SPIN... or SLING.

Combining the words Spin and Swing and then throwing a ! in the middle because we thought it'd be cool! But pro-tip don't use ! in your games name.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: MORFINS
boardgame.description:
MORFINS is a set-collection game for exactly 4 players.

The players each start with 4 cards in hand; on their turn, a player can initiate a round of passing, swap cards with the center, or exit the round.

Once a player has exited the round, the other players have up to 2 additional turns, and then the players score their hands. The player with the largest set (for instance, 4 of a kind) receives 2 chips from the player with the lowest set.

The player with the most points after 4 rounds wins.

boardgame.name: 敗者の権利 (Losers' Rights)
boardgame.description:
Rights of Losers is a trick-taking game where players earn points for having the majority of chips around cards played to a grid on the table.

More specifically, it is a must-follow game where the players who do not win a trick place influence chips into a grid. The winner of a trick chooses two cards that were played to the trick and adds them to the grid; the winner may also avail themselves of one special action.

At the end of the hand, the cards in the grid are worth the number of points shown, and those points are granted to the player with the most influence chips around the card.

The player with the most points after 1 round wins.

boardgame.name: Try!Angler
boardgame.description:
In Try!Angler, the players, as fishermen, fight against government restrictions to catch their dinner.

On a player's turn, they draw a line across four boards which make up an image of the ocean. If the line completes a triangle, the player writes their initials in the triangle, marking their ownership.

Some of the contents of a triangle will grant a player positive points and some negative.

Once no additional lines can be drawn, the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Foundry
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





FOUNDRY is a first-person factory building simulation set in an endless procedurally generated voxel world. While you start small by crafting your first items and machines by hand, you will soon find yourself surrounded by a large sci-fi factory doing the work for you. You need to expand your factory by building more production lines, conveyor belts and pipes while keeping a stable power supply for your growing energy demands. By conducting research, you will unlock more advanced, complex and faster technology to optimize the design and maximize the output of your factory. Solo or cooperatively with friends!KEY FEATURES
First-Person 3D: The player traverses a 3D world in first-person view and has the ability to jump and sprint.
Stylized Sci-Fi Theme: The game's overall theme is a stylized and futuristic sci-fi world with various biomes like forests, jungles, deserts and mountains. More biomes will follow during the Alpha Preview period. The game's art is done by our amazing partners at ZugZug Studio.
Procedural Voxel World: Every new game generates a completely new world. Terrain, vegetation, biome placement and everything else is procedurally generated. Game worlds are infinite along the cardinal directions, while the up/down axis is limited to 255 meters/voxel blocks. Each voxel block can be mined and placed at a different position, allowing players to modify the world to fit their desires.
Base Building: FOUNDRY's core gameplay is building a factory. Players will needs to place and construct foundations, buildings, machines and various other structures like decorative objects or lights to build a factory that produces enough items to progress through the game.
Crafting: The game has dozens of items and crafting recipes from ores to intermediate components like machinery parts to advanced objects like curcuit boards or energy cells. Crafting is required to build machines, for research and to unlock new mechanics.
Automation & Logistics Management: Automation is key in streamlining complex crafting tasks to satisfy the demand of items. Machines can be connected by conveyor belts which transport items. The later game introduces pipes and chemical processing machines to automate liquid & gas refining. Tuning the amount of machines and their connections as well planning logistical patterns is one of the key challenges of FOUNDRY.
Research and Progression: At the very beginning, only a couple of machines and buildings are available. The game gains additional complexity and content by using research to unlock advanced technologies. Conducting research is the main progression path in FOUNDRY.
Multiplayer: FOUNDRY can be played in cooperative multiplayer and although there is no player limit, we recommend 2-4 players based on the current content. It is best played by working together on one factory, but it could be played in a way where every player manages their own factory but contributes to global research.
Modding: While not yet unlocked, the game has been designed for strong mod support and it will become available gradually during the Alpha Preview period.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Prison (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
boardgame.description: The Sheriff meeple will capture one opposing thief on the road and will send them to the Prison for 6 turns. All the other thieves on the road will run away, back to players' supplies.

boardgame.name: Path of Morality
boardgame.description:
Storypath Cards offer your gaming group a new way to roleplay, no matter which game system you use. These cards provide a unique way for you to create more dynamic and detailed stories by harnessing your players’ imaginations. Storypath Cards empower and encourage the players to add to the story of your game.

These cards allow a player to break into the action and add a new detail or twist to the story. Usually, this is something which adds to the mood or atmosphere of the story, but often it can actually affect the plot. Each Storypath Card suggests a different kind of intervention, but interpretation of just what a particular Storypath Card allows is up to the player and GM. Players should never be pawns thrust about by the GM’s schemes, but they can now be full participants in an unfolding story.

Each deck of Storypath Cards contains 36 cards divided into these types: Theme Cards, Tone Cards, and Climax Cards. Each of the cards has a title, a short description to guide their use, an illustration, and a number from one to seven that determines when it can be played.

The Path of Morality is themed for use with any setting when you want to add a sense of moral dilemma and decision-making to your game.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Path of Chivalry
boardgame.description:
Storypath Cards offer your gaming group a new way to roleplay, no matter which game system you use. These cards provide a unique way for you to create more dynamic and detailed stories by harnessing your players’ imaginations. Storypath Cards empower and encourage the players to add to the story of your game.

These cards allow a player to break into the action and add a new detail or twist to the story. Usually, this is something which adds to the mood or atmosphere of the story, but often it can actually affect the plot. Each Storypath Card suggests a different kind of intervention, but interpretation of just what a particular Storypath Card allows is up to the player and GM. Players should never be pawns thrust about by the GM’s schemes, but they can now be full participants in an unfolding story.

Each deck of Storypath Cards contains 36 cards divided into these types: Theme Cards, Tone Cards, and Climax Cards. Each of the cards has a title, a short description to guide their use, an illustration, and a number from one to seven that determines when it can be played.

The Path of Chivalry is themed for use with any setting when you want to add a sense of honor and valor to your game.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Iaijutsu
boardgame.description:
Theme
2 Players are catapulted in a Japanese samurai movie right at the very beginning of a duel, they must follow the cinematic canon:
-the talk: a bluff game
-the stare: a resource management game
-the fight: outsmart your opponent
No part is more important than the others and the outcome is never given for granted where honour is as important as blood.

Mechanics and Components
This game it's all comprised in 15 tarot size cards and 30 tokens, but don't let the size fool you, it's a mid to heavy game of bluff, resource management and out-thinking the opponents intentions.

To whom the game is intended
The game is for heavy card gamer as CCG and LCG players (especially Netrunner players) and all players that enjoy to think deeply on the consequences of they moves.

To whom this game is not intended
Casual players, one-of players, multi-players solitaire lovers

Why PNP
I think this game is so minimal in its components that betrays its expectations by providing an deep and unforgiving (and I hope unforgettable) play experience. Given this characteristics it becomes hard to sell as a physical product therefore decided to release it as a PNP.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Xenowerk Tactics
boardgame.description:
Play as the commander of an emergency response team after a disaster at a secret lab, hidden deep in the arctic region. Your task is to cover up and maximize profits for the Xenowerk corporation, or to save the world, depending on whom you ask...

EXPLORE
Deploy squads on expeditions into the infected zone. Explore a ferocious landscape scattered with remnants of Xenowerk's absurd research facilities. Use skills, traits and mutations to mitigate the dangers, horrors and mishaps during your journeys.

Push your operatives to the limit, not to waste any precious time. Explore jungles, swamps, laboratories, shelters and factories. Scavenge for valuable resources. Carry out various missions. Secure strategic safe zones. Find and rescue M.I.A. operatives.

FIGHT
Control your squad in real-time combat against hordes of mutants. Use operative skills and mutations, such as Frag Grenade, Bait & Trap, Adrenaline, Pyrokinesis and much more, to skew the odds in your favor. Activate Tactical Pause at any time to give more detailed orders.

MANAGE
Recruit and evolve Marines, Rangers and Scientists as your operatives. But choose wisely, some may obtain dubious traits or mutations.

Spend gathered resources to enhance your base of operations; Barracks, Recruitment, Field hospital, Armory, etc. Spend earnings on treatments, upgrades and recruitment.

Cater for the whims of the Xenowerk Management to keep getting funded. Earn some extra cash-under-the-table by selling off resources on the Black Market. Or maybe try to save the world...

Publisher Blurb

boardgame.name: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods – Swamp Zombies
boardgame.description: 6 sculpted swamp zombie models to replace the swamp zombie tokens in Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Gatefall: Lost in the North Woods

boardgame.name: Blaster Bolts (#11 - The Easy Job)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This super-sized 11th issue of Blaster Bolts features

The Easy Job- Bounty Hunting is never an easy job in this new short story of sci-fi action.
The Priviledged Doctor- a new playable class for the White Star RPG by Mark Hess (with input from James M. Spahn.
Descendants of Man - a new White Star adventure in the Synborg Apocalypse setting from RPG lumnary Darrin Drader

boardgame.name: Atlas City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dive into the PDF of Atlas City a very easy to use supplement to the FASERIP inspired “Astonishing Super Heroes” this product will be needed to better understand and use for Atlas City.

Atlas City features a detailed demographic of the city, notable locations (with more to come), and origin stories that can easily be customized to suit your gameplay needs.

Plus, the book contains numerous NPCs, maps, adventure seeds, and an in-depth timeline of Atlas City for one of the most upcoming popular superhero RPG systems around!

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Swamps (2.0 - PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wilderness Dressing: Swamps presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: Flick Forts
boardgame.description:
In Flick Forts, players take charge of an endearing team of well-intentioned but poorly trained fantasy characters, each vying for battlefield control.

Characters are represented by poker chips that form a player's starting fort. Each turn, players take a character from their fort and use the chip to attack the opponent, Crokinole-style, or to build a defence.

Akin to curling, attacking characters will score points for ending the game in their opponent's endzone. Knocking chips from the enemy fort will reduce an opponent's character pool, and defences left standing at the end of the game will earn bonus points.

Flick Forts can be converted from basic to advanced mode (featuring asymmetric character abilities focusing on different dexterity playstyles) in under 5 seconds, and features language-independent gameplay components.

The chip-flicking, tower-toppling excitement of Flick Forts is perfect for friendly, head-to-head battles or grudgematch-style tournament play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Crime Scene: Lazio 1356
boardgame.description:
Lazio is the fifth game in the Crime Scene family. It follows the same puzzle solving format as its predecessors. This game is set in a medieval monastery, where recent events have frightened away most of the monks. The story is written by the awarded author Arttu Tuominen.
In the puzzles you get to investigate a broken down cart with strange wheels, a night sky with shooting starts, a pot where man has been boiled, and many other things.
The high age recommendation comes from a few graphic details in the story. These can be skipped by parents playing with their children (12+), as long as they are aware such exist in the game.

boardgame.name: Crime Scene: ISS Excalibur
boardgame.description:
ISS Excalibur is the sixth game in the Crime Scene family. It follows the same mystery solving format as its predecessors, but is set in the near future in an international Space Station.
The puzzles range from fairly light ones to quite challenging ones, and the showcase some very nice and new mechanics. The story is again written by awarded author Arttu Tuominen, and the only way to get to read the finish, is by solving the puzzles!
The high age recommendation comes from a few graphic details in the story. These can be skipped by parents playing with their children (12+), as long as they are aware such exist in the game.

boardgame.name: Würfelhelden
boardgame.description: In Würfelhelden, you become a hero or heroine and, together with your group, take on villains who are up to mischief in the kingdom. With the luck of the dice, you can secure rewards or find valuable treasures.

boardgame.name: JUST DANCE KIDS 2014
boardgame.description: Just Dance Kids 2014 is a video game for the Wii and is part of the Just Dance video game franchise. Just Dance Kids 2014 is a dance-based music game but with popular kids songs. The game contains over 40 songs. Wikipedia

boardgame.name: Conroi: The Medieval Card Game
boardgame.description:
A true tactical card game were every card matters.
Realistic and deep gameplay yet Easy to learn.

Use real battle tactics to outmaneuver your enemy or simply try to overpower them by sheer numbers.

In this card game consisting of 72 cards, two players fight across the battlefield in an attempt to win a best of five rounds.

Each player has 27 differently designed highly detailed Soldier cards and 9 Tactics cards all with quality artwork.

Use your cards at your disposal in the most effective way to undermine your opponent or take them out by outsmarting them.

The game is designed for fans of historical battles and strategic gameplay were no game plays out the same way.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Pagan: Fate of Roanoke – Influence wheels
boardgame.description: Wooden influence wheels, which are connected with magnets. This replace the cardboard wheels.

boardgame.name: Tannic
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

4 days ago, three village youth went camping to prove their courage during a midsummer festival. 3 days ago, they failed to return. Can you brave the haunted forest and bring them home to safety?

Tannic is a love letter to the pine barrens, youthful adventures, and campfire stories. It's intended as a level 1-3 one shot adventure with stats provided for Cairn and Old School Essentials. It is dynamic and easily adaptable to your system of choice.

boardgame.name: 14 Frantic Minutes
boardgame.description:
You’ve been working as an engineer for a brilliant but very eccentric scientist and you’ve just discovered that the project you’ve been working on is not the climate change solution it was touted to be. It’s a Doomsday device!

You rush to tell your fellow engineers. They see your evidence and everyone agrees this could only mean one thing. Now you all have to escape his high-tech lab by working together and using your contributions to the project, so that you can tell others before it’s too late!

Suddenly, you hear the sounds of someone heading your way. It’s him. Frantically you each grab the circuitry you were working on and rush for the door. An announcement comes from overhead. "Fourteen minutes ‘til lockdown". You've got to get out, and fast!

Players work together by flipping, turning, rotating, and placing polyomino shaped circuit pieces to complete connections in each room to get one step closer to escape and then complete the tricky final circuit before you’re caught and run out of time. Hurry up! The clock is ticking! 14 Frantic Minutes is a real-time cooperative game. You all win or lose together.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Siege Command: The Conclave Wars
boardgame.description:
Siege Command’s first expansion: The Conclave Wars brings three new Tribes into the fray. Not only do each of these Tribes introduce asymmetric gameplay, but they also bring unique mechanics that deepen the gameplay and strategy. The expansion also includes new optional Terrain types that can be used to further deepen the game’s strategy.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Star Classes: Envoys
boardgame.description:
The Life of the Party

Star Classes: Envoys is the latest volume in our new series of class-focused player supplements expanding the possibilities the spacefaring classes of the Starfinder Roleplaying Game! Engage in verbal sparring, subtle persuasion, and shouts of victory with over 70 new rules and flavor elements for envoys, including new feats for combat and conversation along with expanded skill uses for Bluff, Diplomacy, Intimidate, and Sense Motive! You’ll find new improvisations like Ambush Savvy, Keep It Together, and Come and Get Me, alongside expertise talents like Wheel and Deal, Probe Intentions, and Planar Agent. You’ll also find a pair of archetypes in the multitalented Polymath and the Engram Channeler tapping into the literal ghosts in the shell! Plus, you get 6 ready-to-use envoy characters and creatures from CR 5 to 16 like the imperial ambassador and the alien tentacled telepath! Grab this fantastic 28-page Starfinder character by Matt Daley, Jeff Lee, Lyz Liddell, and Jason Nelson and Make Your Game Legendary!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Fire & Stone: Siege of Vienna 1683
boardgame.description:
A 100,000-strong Ottoman army arrives outside the Habsburg capital of Vienna. Inside the city, 12,000 infantry, a city militia, and citizen-soldiers mount a desperate defense. As the Ottoman siege lines draw closer to the city walls, the outnumbered Viennese cling to the faint hope a relief force will arrive in time to save them. For both sides, the real battle is a race against time.

Fire & Stone: Siege of Vienna 1683 places you in one of the most dramatic sieges in history. With a completely different set of cards for each player, you will conduct deadly assaults against impenetrable fortifications, dig tunnels packed with explosives, and launch desperate attacks to delay your enemy's advance. Or you can play powerful events with the power to change the course of battle!

Includes historical notes about the siege and 17th century siege warfare (knowledge not required to play the game).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Napoleon 1815: Playmat
boardgame.description: This giant playmat 80 cm x 80 cm for Napoleon 1815 is printed on a 2mm neoprene base. It will offer you an unequalled comfort of play in addition to highlighting the graphic work of our artist, Nicolas Treil.

boardgame.name: Bard's Gate Wealth and Social Status Download
boardgame.description:
It is sometimes helpful when running a city setting as large and thorough as Bards Gate to have a little help in determining how much PCs are spending on nights in cheap hotels and flagons of Brin Zwiescher Ale. Invariably there is downtime between campaigns. Weeks and possibly months may go by as a pair of party members “crafts magic items” and the others sit around and wait for their new goodies. If this time is not spent as it should be, adventuring within the walls of the great and illustrious city of Bards Gate, then it is most certainly spent on “something.”

Web enhancement

boardgame.name: NPCs and Locations
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

NPCs and Locations RPG supplement includes lore of NPCs and locations plus secrets, rumors and adventure hooks to use them in your games.

Basically, the game master’s job is to propose locations and NPCs to their players and see how things evolve; I thought that a great, useful addition to my RPG supplements library would be a book with cool characters and places to use in your games. Legends, peculiar locations, and strange people to insert into the path of your party and see what decisions they make.

The book is as descriptive and rules-light as possible and meant to be used with any Fantasy RPG.

What would your party do if they encounter an abandoned goblin child? Would they take him with them? And imagine it's an offering for a monstrous deity who will now hunt down the baby wherever he goes (along with the party).

Perhaps the party will meet Tharg Grott, a dungeon merchant who is always in the right place at the right time.

Or they could visit Belias' room, the place where the now-deceased famous detective solved many of his cases. Unfortunately, many are left behind, including a prolific serial killer he was unable to catch.

boardgame.name: The Night Parade
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Along the Empire’s roads, the dead walk. Called from their slumber by a necromancer’s profane whispers, or buried where dark magic saturates the ground, these Undead march without rest, adding to their number with each hapless soul they cross. Whether such bands move with a purpose or wander aimlessly, they often find themselves the centre of folk tales. Many a terrified tavern audience has gathered around the fire to hear stories of wild hunts, ghostly processions, and corpse-laden carts come to carry away the unwary. Of these, one story has risen to prominence. If you wander through the fertile lands between the Grey Mountains and the Reikwald Forest, listen always for the sounds of creaking wheels and a tolling bell. Do not wait to ask the carriage for a lift. Hide. Cover your ears. And whatever you do, do not follow where the bell leads. The Night Parade are calling.

The Night Parade are a band of wandering Undead, drawn together by the ancient Liche, Old Jasper. Setting out from the Grey Mountains when both moons shine as crescents, he leads his charges through the Vorbergland, calling the dead to him wherever they go. There appears to be little rhyme or reason to the Night Parade’s journeys. Yet, each time they are sighted, their numbers are sure to grow.

Alongside full profiles for personalities such as Old Jasper and his Wight Lieutenants are templates to advance the basic Undead creatures found in the Warhammer Fantasy Rulebook, turning them into Liche Corpsemasters, Liche Lords, Wights, Wight Champions, and Mass Grave Dead, as well as templates to raise mounts as Undead steeds. The Night Parade also includes full rules and adventure hooks for including Corpse Carts in your games.

boardgame.name: Barrakuda
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Cartagena, Colombia! The colonial houses in this historical town are a testimony to its colorful past. You, on the other hand, are more interested in old shipwrecks — more specifically, sunken Spanish galleons filled with gold. Time to embark on an old-fashioned underwater treasure hunt. What you didn't anticipate is that several of you have discovered the legends of these buried riches. To make matters worse, a barracuda is prowling through the shipwrecks.

The challenge in Barrakuda is to be the first player to have eight gold pieces in their vault, but before you can lock away gold in your vault, you need to find it on shipwrecks or steal it from others.

To set up the game, lay out shipwreck cards numbered 1-6 in some orthogonal arrangement, and give each player movement cards numbered 1-5, along with a barracuda card. On a turn, each player chooses a card from their hand, then they reveal them simultaneously. If you played a movement card, move your pawn to that shipwreck card; if you're the only player there (and the barracuda isn't), take both the special action and general action listed on the card. If more than one player is on the same shipwreck card, then whoever has the fewest movement cards in front of them has the initiative and can either take the special action or take all the gold from one player's bag; after this, all players take this card's general action.

If you're the only one who played a barracuda card, roll the distance die, then move it up to that many spaces in the direction of your choice. If a barracuda is on the same space as a player, they have to drop their gold on that shipwreck space; others can pick up that gold starting next turn. If none or more than one player play barracuda, roll the direction and distance card to determine where it goes.

Actions on cards let you pick up gold, move gold from your bag to your vault, protect you from the barracuda, take back movement cards, move the barracuda, and so on.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieler Spieldauer: 20 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 8+
BARRAKUDA - Tauchen auf hoher See Cartagena in Kolumbien ist eine geschichtsträchtige Stadt mit Kolonialhäusern, die von einer reichen Vergangenheit zeugen. Dein Interesse sind die alten Wracks der spanischen Galeonen, die mit Gold gefüllt sind. Du machst dich also auf zu einer Unterwasser-Schatzsuche. Was du nicht erwartet hast, ist, dass auch andere von den Reichtümern gehört haben, die nicht weit von hier zu finden sind. In Barrakuda suchst du nach Schiffswracks. Dein Ziel? So viel Gold wie möglich zu ergattern. Aber hüte dich vor den bissigen Barrakudafischen, die zwischen den Wracks lauern, sie könnten dich bei deiner Suche aufhalten. Deine Strategie ist es, den Gefahren auszuweichen und deinen Schatz so schnell wie möglich an die Oberfläche zu bringen. Benutze deine Spezialkarte, um die Barrakudas auf deine GegnerInnen loszuschicken und sie dazu zu bringen, Zeit zu verlieren.
Inhalt: 44 Karten 4 Spielfiguren 1 Barrakuda Figur 2 Würfel 36 Jetons 1 Spialanleitung
https://youtu.be/1soCTrMsJtA
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN, FR, IT

boardgame.name: Catchy Match
boardgame.description: Catchy-Match is above all a rough backyard soccer field spectacle than a slick Champions league Cup match. Here, two proud character teams challenge each other, betting on who can most trickily use their opportunities to score a goal. If only there wasn't the matter of luck. The dice decides which possibilities there are and sometimes it also prevents the victory that was thought to be certain. Especially people who are enthusiastic about the game and don't know anything about soccer can quickly get ahead of the game and show the supposed soccer pros how to win a match.

boardgame.name: Lucidity: Six-sided Nightmares – Bone Hunters Expansion
boardgame.description:
A set of eight dice and one instruction card for Lucidity: Six-sided Nightmares. The Bone Hunters Expansion was part of the deluxe edition through Fox Tale Games's Kickstarter campaign, but is now available as a separate expansion for the retail version of the game.

These dice are extremely powerful but extremely dangerous, so use them wisely!

boardgame.name: Kings of Edom
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Kings of Edom is a fantasy adventure that places you as the lone hero exploring twelve levels of mazes in your quest to find the lost crowns. The game was made by PhOBoZ.
